intro: Dugandiodendron mahechae, commonly known as the Madagascar starling tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. The species is notable for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
